header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: Parent’s evening, struggling with Maths, eating dinner, World Book Day, characters in books, going to a circus, arrangements after school, what cooked human flesh smells like!
header.activity: Family talking about parent’s evening feedback
header.conv_type: Discussing, explaining, anecdote telling, making arrangements

body.u: so do you want to know what was said at parents evening?
yeah? I'll start with you so Mr is very pleased he says that you've matured a lot in the last four months do you know what that means?
erm no not really it's hard to explain

more more grown up really so he said you're very sensible and you can be relied upon to be sensible and make others around you work hard and he is very pleased with your progress in all subjects the only issue we were talking about was handwriting
I am left-handed which means I'm

I know and he knows and I I am also left-handed but that's really good so no issues whatsoever and mrs was also very pleased with your progress she said your love of language and books and reading and everything and stories is fantastic cos you're good at writing stories as well as reading about them maths you're a little bit worried about

she says you find it you know you haven't quite decided the best way to work things out so you're always a little bit concerned but she said that'll be fine you'll come on no problems at all and that she loved how much you liked studying George Stevenson
whatever his name is so I'm both very I'm very proud of you both absolutely fantastic
although the only reason I learnt how to get quite good at maths
is experimenting with different ways of how to work things out and then saw which one was the easiest

mm mm well that is one thing that Mr said actually with your big maths on a Friday he said sometimes you're like really good like top of the you know near top of the class and then other times you really struggle
is that because it's ti you're tired sometimes? or
cos sometimes erm we do big maths first and other times we do forty-four club and a hundred forty-four club
and I'm quite shaken up after the stress of a hundred and forty-four club
is that the times table thing?
mm he did say that you do need to practice your time tables more at home
yeah I find times tables and division very difficult
I know but if you practice them you'll get a bit better
after all the way home all the way home forty-four questions in five minutes
mm and he was also saying that you d have to do handwriting every day all of you at the moment
mm which is a lot to ask but he was very impressed and Mrs was very impressed with you so that's great isn't it?
the reason why I'm struggling with maths is because well if people like do theirs quickly
I'd need to I need to like get a hint on the answer and
on the answer and do you know what? I'm really bad at kind of division or something
mm I find that hard too
and I'm really and I'm really bad erm like at halving odd numbers
it's like I say eleven can you subtract that? measure if something was eleven we need to do the next number down
and basically I basically got one erm eleven
and and that was a twelve
yeah I got one eleven and the others were twelve
okay I'm very bad at maths myself so

yeah who chose it? first tell me that

I can't remember now they said it on your hand out
cos cos you didn't in homework so that's good
yeah I got twenty out of twenty I think

like like like like this like Geranimo or Geronimo like that
yeah Geronimo I would find quite tricky

she only showed me the the web links like what the name is of the website so I haven't actually seen them myself
